New Records: Finn Allen surpassed Brendon McCullum's record for the highest individual score by a New Zealander in T20Is with 137 runs.
Finn Allen equalled the record of 16 sixes in an inning previously held by Afghanistan's Hazratullah Zazai.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen scored 137 runs in only 62 deliveries, including 16 sixes and 5 boundaries.
New Zealand set a target of 225 runs and won the match by 45 runs.
Pakistan's Babar Azam scored his third consecutive half-century in the series with 58 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and opted to field first.
New Zealand played without Kane Williamson, who was injured in the previous match, and Mitchell Santner took over the captaincy.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans from around the world reacted on social media to Finn Allen's performance.
